definition: sports lottery (sports betting run by a government agency, China Sports Lottery) (abbr. for 體育彩票|体育彩票[ti3 yu4 cai3 piao4])

sentences.english: Where is the address of center of shenzhen body colour excuse me specific address?
sentences.chinese: 请问深圳体彩中心的地址在什么地方，具体地址？

sentences.english: Security guards also restricted access to the lottery center, the Chongqing Evening News reports.
sentences.chinese: 体彩中心的入口也进行了严格的安全保护。

sentences.english: When Italian artist Guido Daniele was hired by an advertising agency to create body painting of animals, he loved the idea.
sentences.chinese: 创作动物图案的人体彩绘时，他非常喜欢这个创意。

definition: lottery run by China Welfare Lottery, a government agency that uses a portion of the money from ticket sales to fund welfare projects (abbr. for 福利彩票[fu2 li4 cai3 piao4])
to announce the winners in a lottery
to win a prize/a successful gamble
large-sized (of clothes, shoes)/(old) to give an order/(old) to quit one's job in a store
to draw the winning ticket (in a lottery)
to try to answer a question (in a quiz, guessing game, riddle etc)/quiz game
